intro: Pimpinella welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's cowpea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
